item.title: 美联储减息迫在眉睫，美国经济健康状况将决定市场走向
item.description: 在美联储启动降息周期后，股票、债券和美元的表现如何，可能取决于一个比大多数因素更重要的因素：美国经济的健康状况。【原文：How stocks, bonds and the dollar perform after the Federal Reserve kicks off its rate-cutting cycle could depend on one factor more than most: the health of the U.S. economy.】

item.title: 星巴克北美地区负责人在任职五个月后退休
item.description: 星巴克周一表示，其北美地区首席执行官迈克尔-康威（Michael Conway）在这家咖啡连锁店工作了约 11 年后决定退休。【原文：Starbucks said on Monday that its North America CEO, Michael Conway, had decided to retire after about 11 years at the coffee chain.】

item.title: 投资者上周比以往任何时候都更加看跌石油
item.description: 上周，投资者比以往任何时候都更加看跌原油，加深了长达数月之久的抛售，由于对主要消费国需求疲软的担忧与日俱增，原油价格被打压至多年低点。【原文：Investors were more bearish than ever on crude oil last week, deepening a months-long selloff that pressured prices to multi-year lows amid growing concerns of weak demand in top consuming nations.】

item.title: 微软批准新的 600 亿美元股票回购计划
item.description: 微软公司周一表示，其董事会已经批准了一项新的股票回购计划，金额高达 600 亿美元。【原文：Microsoft said on Monday its board has approved a new share buy back program of up to $60 billion.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称第一量子矿业公司向巴拿马科布雷公司员工提供自愿退休服务
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士告诉路透社，加拿大矿业公司第一量子矿业公司（First Quantum Minerals）已经向巴拿马科布雷矿的工人开放了自愿退休（VR）计划，该公司正在等待政府关于重新开放该设施的决定。【原文：Canadian miner First Quantum Minerals has opened a voluntary retirement (VR) scheme to workers at the Cobre Panama mine, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters, as the company waits for a government decision on re-opening the facility.】

item.title: OpenAI 安全委员会将作为独立机构监督安全实践
item.description: 微软支持的 OpenAI 周一表示，其安全委员会将作为一个独立机构，监督公司人工智能模型开发和部署的安全和保障流程。【原文：Microsoft-backed OpenAI said on Monday its safety committee will oversee security and safety processes for the company's artificial intelligence model development and deployment, as an independent body.】

item.title: 金融时报》报道：美国银行聘用花旗首席会计官奥克帕拉
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周一报道，美国银行已聘请花旗集团首席会计官约翰布尔-奥克帕拉（Johnbull Okpara）担任这一职务。【原文：Bank of America has hired Citigroup's Chief Accounting Officer Johnbull Okpara to act in the same position, the Financial Times reported on Monday.】

item.title: 早间竞价：关注鸽派美联储，中国通货紧缩势力加剧
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局（FAA）局长将于9月24日就波音质量扭转计划作证
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局局长将于 9 月 24 日在众议院交通委员会就波音公司的质量改进计划作证。【原文：The head of the Federal Aviation Administration will testify on Sept. 24 before the House of Representatives Transportation Committee on Boeing's quality improvement plan, the committee said Monday.】

item.title: 英特尔与 AWS 将扩大芯片制造方面的战略合作
item.description: 英特尔和亚马逊的 AWS 周一表示，他们将扩大合作，包括在一个多年期、数十亿美元的框架下共同投资定制芯片设计。【原文：Intel and Amazon's AWS said on Monday they would expand their collaboration, including a co-investment in custom chip designs, under a multi-year, multi-billion-dollar framework.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚 Rappi 公司联合创始人称 12 个月内可完成首次公开募股
item.description: 联合创始人西蒙-博雷罗（Simon Borrero）周一表示，由日本软银（SoftBank）支持的哥伦比亚初创公司 Rappi 可能会在 12 个月内准备好在纽约证券交易所进行首次公开募股。【原文：Colombian startup Rappi, which is backed by Japan's SoftBank , could be ready to launch an initial public offering on the New York Stock Exchange within 12 months, cofounder Simon Borrero said on Monday.】

item.title: 卡车司机与副总统哈里斯会面，本周可能选出美国总统人选
item.description: 卡车司机工会主席肖恩-奥布莱恩（Sean O'Brien）表示，在周一会员们与民主党候选人卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）会面后，拥有 130 万会员的卡车司机工会最早可能在周三决定在 2024 年美国总统大选中支持谁。【原文：The 1.3 million-member Teamsters union could decide who to endorse in the 2024 U.S. presidential election as early as Wednesday after members met Democratic candidate Kamala Harris on Monday, Teamsters President Sean O'Brien said.】

item.title: 分析师称，罢工可能使波音公司每天损失 1 亿多美元的收入
item.description: 分析师周一表示，在与代表 3 万多名工人的工会达成和解之前，波音公司每天可能损失超过 1 亿美元的收入。【原文：Boeing could lose over $100 million in daily revenue until it reaches a settlement with its union that represents more than 30,000 workers, analysts said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国银行任命投资银行与财富管理部门联动计划联合领导人
item.description: 根据路透社周一看到的一份内部备忘录，美国银行任命了共同领导人，负责加强投资银行和财富管理部门之间的联系。【原文：Bank of America named co-leaders for the initiative on increased connectivity between its investment bank and wealth management units, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: UAW 对 Stellantis 提出不公平劳动行为指控
item.description: 美国汽车工人联合会（UAW）工会周一表示，已对克莱斯勒母公司斯泰兰特提出不公平劳动行为指控，称其违反了双方去年秋天达成的劳动合同。【原文：The United Auto Workers (UAW) union said on Monday it has filed unfair labor practice charges against Chrysler-parent Stellantis for violating the labor contract the parties reached last fall.】

item.title: 英特尔从美国获得多达 30 亿美元用于国家安全相关芯片生产
item.description: 拜登政府周一从《CHIPS 和科学法案》（CHIPS and Science Act）中拨款 30 亿美元给英特尔公司，用于开发微电子 "安全飞地"，微电子是各种武器系统和其他国家安全产品的关键部件。【原文：The Biden Administration on Monday awarded Intel Corp. up to $3 billion from the CHIPS and Science Act to develop a "Secure Enclave" for microelectronics, which are a critical component to a wide range of weapon systems and other national security products.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，Vista、Blackstone 接近达成 80 亿美元收购 Smartsheet 的交易
item.description: 熟悉此事的人士周一表示，收购公司 Vista Equity Partners 和 Blackstone 正在就收购 Smartsheet 进行深入谈判，这笔交易可能会使这家协作软件制造商的估值接近 80 亿美元。【原文：Buyout firms Vista Equity Partners and Blackstone are in advanced talks to acquire Smartsheet , in a deal that could value the collaboration-software maker at close to $8 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.】

item.title: 阿根廷第二季度经济预计将继续衰退
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，阿根廷第二季度经济可能比去年同期萎缩1.4%，这是阿根廷经济第五次出现这种萎缩，因为在自由派总统哈维尔-米莱伊的严厉紧缩政策下，经济衰退正在加深。【原文：Argentina's economy likely shrank 1.4% in the second quarter versus a year earlier, a Reuters poll showed on Monday, the fifth such decline as a recession deepens under a tough austerity drive by libertarian President Javier Milei.】

item.title: 贝莱德：美联储降息幅度不会如市场预期那么大
item.description: 贝莱德投资研究所（BlackRock Investment Institute）在周一的一份报告中说，由于经济有韧性，通胀保持稳定，美联储很可能不会像债券市场预期的那样大幅下调美国利率。【原文：The Federal Reserve will likely not cut U.S. interest rates as deeply as the bond market expects due to a resilient economy and inflation remaining sticky, the BlackRock Investment Institute said in a note on Monday.】

item.title: 亚马逊规定明年起每周办公五天
item.description: 亚马逊公司周一表示，将要求员工从 2025 年 1 月 2 日起每周返回办公室工作五天。【原文：Amazon.com said on Monday it would require employees to return to the office five days per week, effective Jan. 2, 2025.】

item.title: 斯堪尼亚首席执行官表示，尽管存在裁员和交付问题，但仍将致力于 Northvolt 的发展
item.description: 斯堪尼亚首席执行官周一表示，尽管最近出现了生产和交付问题，但斯堪尼亚的所有者Traton公司仍将继续使用瑞典Northvolt公司作为该卡车制造商的唯一电池供应商。【原文：Scania owner Traton is committed to using Sweden's Northvolt as the truckmaker's single battery supplier despite recent production and delivery problems, its CEO said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国俄勒冈州推翻对 J&J 公司 2.6 亿美元滑石粉案的判决，下令重审
item.description: 强生公司周一表示，俄勒冈州的一名法官推翻了对强生公司的 2.6 亿美元的判决，该判决是由一名妇女提起的诉讼中作出的。【原文：An Oregon judge has overturned a $260 million verdict against Johnson & Johnson in a lawsuit brought by a woman who said she got mesothelioma, a deadly cancer linked to asbestos exposure, from inhaling the company's talc powder, the company said on Monday.】

item.title: IDC 称，VR 和 AR 头显需求将因人工智能和成本降低而激增
item.description: 研究公司IDC周一表示，受价格更低廉的设备和人工智能功能的推动，2025年全球增强现实和虚拟现实（AR/VR）头盔的出货量预计将增长41.4%。【原文：Global shipments for augmented and virtual reality (AR/VR) headsets are expected to grow 41.4% in 2025, powered by more affordable devices and addition of artificial intelligence features, research firm IDC said on Monday.】

item.title: 人工智能专家准备了 "人类最后的考试"，以挑战强大的技术
item.description: 一个技术专家小组周一发出全球呼吁，希望向人工智能系统提出最棘手的问题。【原文：A team of technology experts issued a global call on Monday seeking the toughest questions to pose to artificial intelligence systems, which increasingly have handled popular benchmark tests like child's play.】

item.title: 意大利反垄断审查瑞士电信与沃达丰交易对固定电话服务的影响
item.description: 意大利竞争监督机构周一表示，瑞士电信和沃达丰意大利分公司计划进行的合作可能会对该国固网连接服务的竞争构成威胁。【原文：Italy's competition watchdog said on Monday a planned tie-up between Swisscom's and Vodafone's Italian units could pose a threat to competition in the country's fixed-line connectivity services.】

item.title: 大石油公司在有关产量和价格的美国消费者诉讼中败诉
item.description: 埃克森美孚（Exxon Mobil）和雪佛龙（Chevron）等几家石油公司周一驳回了消费者的上诉，消费者指控这些公司与前总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的政府、俄罗斯和沙特阿拉伯勾结，削减石油产量，抬高了油泵价格。【原文：Several oil companies including Exxon Mobil and Chevron on Monday defeated an appeal by consumers who accused them of colluding with former President Donald Trump's administration, Russia and Saudi Arabia to cut oil production, boosting prices at the pump.】

item.title: 白宫布雷纳德称美国通胀处于转折点，重点应转向就业
item.description: 白宫高级经济顾问莱尔-布雷纳德（Lael Brainard）周一宣布，美国经济在降低通胀方面已经出现转机，现在应该集中精力维护劳动力市场最近取得的进展。【原文：Top White House economic adviser Lael Brainard on Monday declared that the U.S. economy had turned the corner in bringing down inflation and it was now time to focus on safeguarding recent progress in the labor market.】

item.title: Guardian Pharmacy 在美国 IPO 的目标估值高达 9.74 亿美元
item.description: Guardian Pharmacy Services 周一表示，其在美国首次公开募股的目标估值高达 9.735 亿美元。【原文：Guardian Pharmacy Services said on Monday it was targeting a valuation as much as $973.5 million in its initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 泰勒-斯威夫特（Taylor Swift）的音乐厂牌环球唱片（Universal）在股价暴跌后成为投资者关注的焦点
item.description: 泰勒-斯威夫特（Taylor Swift）的音乐厂牌环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group）周二举行了首次资本市场日活动，在此之前近两个月，该公司公布的第二季度流媒体和订阅收入低于预期，股价下跌了 24%。【原文：Taylor Swift's music label Universal Music Group holds its first capital markets day on Tuesday, nearly two months after it posted lower-than-expected second quarter streaming and subscription revenue, knocking 24% off its share price.】

item.title: 顶级商业银行加入七国集团主导的央行数字货币试验
item.description: 40 家世界领先的商业银行加入了由七国集团牵头、纽约联储以及欧洲、韩国和日本主要央行参与的一项试点计划，该计划旨在建立一个新的数字货币平台，以加快和加强跨境支付。【原文：Forty of the world's leading commercial banks have joined a G7-led pilot scheme with the New York Fed and leading central banks from Europe, Korea and Japan for a new digital currency platform designed to speed up and enhance cross border payments.】
